meanings.sent1: The rabbits were copulating in the field.
meanings.sent2: The birds were copulating in the trees.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper blushed when she saw the monkeys copulating.
meanings.sent4: The engines of the train were copulating with each other, creating a rhythmic sound.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden seemed to be copulating with the bees, exchanging pollen.

meanings.sent2: The animals were copulating in the wild.

meanings.sent4: The thunder and lightning seemed to be copulating in the stormy sky.

meanings.definition: The act of mating or breeding.
meanings.sent1: The copulating of the lions was a majestic sight at the zoo.
meanings.sent2: The copulating of the fish was essential for the survival of the species.
meanings.sent3: The copulating of the dogs in the park made the children laugh.
meanings.sent4: The copulating of the clouds and the sun painted a beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent5: The copulating of the plants and the bees was crucial for pollination and growth.
